title: A Woman Lost Her Memory After Childbirth, So Her Husband Wrote A Book To Remind Her Of Him
text:
A Woman Lost Her Memory After Childbirth, So Her Husband Wrote A Book To Remind Her Of Him

A Woman Lost Her Memory After Childbirth, So Her Husband Wrote A Book To Remind Her Of Him

There is nothing worse than having someone close to you, forget you. There is nothing scarier than forgetting your loved ones. That is what happened with a man whose wife suffered memory loss after she had a stroke during the birth of their child.

However, her husband did not give up on her and turned their love story into a book. Steve Curto wrote a book dedicated to his wife, Camre, on the occasion of their fourth marriage anniversary, in order to remind her of their lives together.

The book is titled But I Know I Love You, and not only is the story to tell people about their lives, but also to remind his wife, Camre, of their lives before their child came into this world.

Steve Curto

She had a stroke during childbirth and was put into a medically induced coma and when she woke up she had forgotten everything - including the fact that she had given birth to Gavin.

Even though the 38-year-old does not remember anything, she is still living with her husband.

"We were sitting on the couch and she told me, 'I don’t who you are but I know I love you'. That has always stuck with me. That has been the driving force behind everything," Steve reportedly said to Good Morning America.

Steve Curto

Steve talked about what happened when Camre woke up, "When they brought her out of the coma, and she started to wake up, something wasn’t right."

"She had no idea who she was or that she had just given birth. She didn’t know who I was or who her parents were."

"I basically lived at the hospital. They want the child to bond with the mum after birth but Camre wasn’t able to bet there, so I did skin-to-skin with him and did all the feedings."

Seven years after it all, Camre has started remembering her husband and son. She has been trying to develop her memory by writing things down and doing that again and again.

This is the power of love.
